comment: What an amazing professor. She knows what she's talking about and really wants to go the extra mile for you as a student. She's an amazing person and cares a lot about her students. If all professors would be like her, I would be in the school system all my life.

This class was very simple. All you have to do is participate in an internship during the semester and you can get a Major Elective credit for it. The teacher's requirements are very straightforward and this course is Pass/Fail, so unfortunately it doesn't boost your GPA.

Overall Mrs Tatum was excellent. A lot of the homework that she made us complete. We did an example in class that was very similar. Gave extra credit opportunities, I strongly advise you take advantage of those they will come in handy more than you know. Would take again, She is the best programming teacher at KSU in my opinion.

Mrs. Tatum was a good professor to have for programming.  She does not have the best skills at explanation, but she will respond to any questions and she is always available in her office if you need her.  Don't skip her lectures, if you do, you'll miss the meat of the material.  Lab day is usually ok to miss if you're confident you can do it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I took this class online.  Overall, it was an easy class if you actually follow along with the course work and are interested in Java programming.  My major problem with this class was the tests/quizzes had syntax errors that skewed your answers.  The professor dropped all the quizzes due to this and I don't think my exams were corrected.

Professor Tatum was a great teacher. Her tests were not too difficult, including her final. Weekly Assignments, but she gives you more than enough time to work at your own pace. I would definitely recommend taking her if you enjoy working at your own pace

I just finished all my work with Professor Tatum. She is a real gem of a teacher. Really involved with her students and makes an effort to be fair. I would without a doubt take a class with her again. I would recommend though to those who need external motivation, to go to another professor. She will not babysit you, but fosters creativity.

Took her online for Data Communication. Pretty easy class, but didn't really learn much. Assignments and quizzes are easy and exams just need a little studying to pass. Put in a bit of effort and you'll pass.
Great professor, Lecture were helpful, Well organized!  Test questions were related to course topics. She is very knowledgeable. I learn a lot!!

Outstanding professor! Make sure you stay on top of all of your work and do the examples she does in class. The examples are very similar to your assignments for the week and your weekly lab as well. She is very kind and will do all she can to help you if you're struggling in her class.

I took her with a hybrid class, so tests were online. The tests were very easy and I got A's on all of them. The only non-open note test was the final, on which I did better than the other tests. The other grades are a few assignments and projects. It's not a hard class, just do your work and you'll get an A. She's very nice and caring.
Great professor. Tests are pretty easy, but she curves on the major ones. Use the extra credit opportunities. Slides are kind of thick, but are made by Bob Brown (so you know they're good)
